text: so our Venture is that we've designed a
smallscale manufacturing process to make
affordable highquality sanitary
menstrual pads out of waste banana tree
fiber there's over 200 million rural
women in India of menstrating age and
that many of them are missing up to 50
days of school or work a year due to
lack of access to Affordable sanitary
pads so I've been very involved in the
social Enterprise club and I was one of
the coire of the social Enterprise
conference here this year and I think
honestly just being surrounded by other
so many other people that are just as
passionate about social Enterprises I am
so being able to bounce off ideas about
business models um how do you actually
scale up technology in rural India and
then just the resources that I was able
to get through the through the iLab The
Rock Center have just been invaluable to
really helping us scale up this this
Venture I think for me it really forced
both me and Kristen to sit there and
make sure we think through every detail
um and really think through okay we
think we know everything but what are
other things that judges are going to
throw at us and the goal is by the end
of this year to be in five Villages
employing about 50 women and providing
pads to over 10,000 women and we really
hope together in the next five years and
with the help and support of everyone
that we met through this competition and
others we hope to meet in the future we
will really be able to increase these
numbers by 50-fold in the next 5 years
HBS is just surrounded by such amazing

it's one of those things where you never
